channel.title: INsmh
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INsmh, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Former CIA agent claims there was life on Mars and he saw ‘bones’ on the surface
item.description: 'It [was] obvious these people were dying for some reason, but they were humans. They were just twice our size.'

item.title: Man Accused Of Swallowing $770K Worth Of Diamonds From Florida Tiffany's
item.description: Jaythan Gilder allegedly asked jailers, “Am I going to be charged with what’s in my stomach?”

item.title: Greek holiday island faces tourism nightmare as recovery plan activated
item.description: A popular holiday destination in Greece is racing to save its tourism season this year as hotel bookings have fallen by 20 per cent following recent s...

item.title: This is why an entire town plays a brutal 16-hour football game on Shrove Tuesday
item.description: Shrovetide ball games have been played in England since Henry II was on the throne.

item.title: One in eight 'nicotine-free' vapes in UK contain highly-addictive substance
item.description: Trading Standards teams tested 76 products sold as 'nicotine free' as part of an initiative tracking the sale of illicit vapes and underage sales and ...

item.title: Runners With Frying Pans Race To Mark Annual Pancake Day
item.description: Racers dressed as a skyscraper, beekeeper and a chest of drawers were among dozens of runners zipping around a central London square with a frying pan...

item.title: Do you agree with calls for a smacking ban in England? Take our poll and have your say
item.description: Experts have renewed calls for the criminalisation of physical punishments for children, amid concerns of 'grey areas' in the current legislation. We ...

item.title: Man With The Golden Arm dies aged 88 after saving lives of 2,400,000 babies
item.description: James Harrison saved millions of lives by donating his extremely rare blood plasma.

item.title: 'Sabrina Carpenter's favourite fake tan has me ditching my go-to bronzing products'
item.description: Sabrina Carpenter swears by Loving Tan's instant bronze shimmer cream for her glowy complexion, and Mirror's shopping writer, Grace, has tested the pr...

item.title: 'I walked out on first date after outrageous response to normal conversation'
item.description: A man has said he walked out on a date after the person he was seeing made him uncomfortable with the 'outrageous' way they responded to him answering...

item.title: Teenager has 16kg ‘parasitic twin’ removed after life-changing surgery
item.description: Less than 50 instances of the phenomena have been recorded by science.

item.title: German Romantics Climb Oak Tree Instead Of Scrolling Tinder
item.description: It’s timber over Tinder in a forest in northern Germany where the Bridegroom’s Oak has connected lovers for more than a century.

item.title: The unusual psychic technique used by the MoD to try and find Osama bin Laden
item.description: 'It was a classic low probability high consequence situation, in that even if people were skeptical, the impact of any successes would be huge.'

item.title: Pokémon-Shaped Cheeto Sells At Auction For Whopping $87,840
item.description: Sixty people attempted to buy the "Cheetozard," a Cheeto shaped like the beloved Pokémon Charizard, during an auction on Sunday.

item.title: Scientists Genetically Engineer Mice With Hair As Thick As Woolly Mammoth
item.description: The researchers have nicknamed the extra-furry rodents the “Colossal woolly mouse.”
